medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient, a 44-year-old man diagnosed with Kallmann Syndrome (KS), presented with hypogonadotropism, anosmia, and prepubertal status.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed at age 22 and had never undergone treatment for his hypogonadism. Symptoms began in adolescence and showed progressive development of hypogonadotropism and skeletal dysplasia over the years. By age 44, he had developed additional conditions such as hypertension and Type II Diabetes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous diagnosis of Kallmann Syndrome, never treated for hypogonadism; developed hypertension and Type II Diabetes at age 44.
medical_history.family_history: The patient was the oldest of 6 full siblings and 3 half-siblings, all without evidence of Kallmann Syndrome or similar reproductive/skeletal disorders.
